intro: Castilleja magnistylis, commonly known as the large-styled castilleja, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red-orange to yellow flowers. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on other plants for water and nutrients, making it a parasitic species. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Castilleja magnistylis plays a role in pollination and provides nectar for various pollinators.
